snippet: Texas will not expand Medicaid eligibility to poor adults, but enrollment in the state’s health program for indigent children and the disabled will still swell in 2014.

byline.contributor: This article was produced in partnership with Kaiser Health News, an independent program of the Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation, a nonprofit, nonpartisan health policy research and communication organization not affiliated with Kaiser Permanente.

lead_paragraph: Texas will not expand Medicaid eligibility to poor adults, but enrollment in the state’s health program for indigent children and the disabled will still swell in 2014.

headline.print_headline: Health Providers Bracing for Medicaid Enrollment
headline.main: Health Providers Bracing for Medicaid Enrollment
